abstract: Donohue's Steak House in Manhattan is one of city's last neighborhood institutions that attracts diverse and loyal clientele, including Asian antiquities dealer Robert Hatfield Ellsworth, who dined there nearly every night over the years; Ellsworth died at age 85 in March, leaving $50,000 each to his two favorite waitresses.
lead_paragraph: A neighborhood restaurant representative of an older New York grabbed media attention recently after one of its patrons left two of his favorite servers $50,000 each.

headline.main: At Donohue’s, a Nightly Steak, a Life Gone By
headline.print_headline: A Nightly Steak, a Life Gone By

snippet: A neighborhood restaurant representative of an older New York grabbed media attention recently after one of its patrons left two of his favorite servers $50,000 each.
